meanings.definition: The act of covering or coating with silver.
meanings.sent1: The silverings on the antique mirror made it shine brightly.
meanings.sent2: I watched as the silverings were carefully applied to the jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The silverings on the cake made it look like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like silverings, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The silverings on the knight's armor reflected the sunlight in dazzling patterns.

meanings.definition: The process of turning silver in color.
meanings.sent1: The silverings of the leaves in autumn signaled the change of season.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the silverings of the metal fence gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent3: The silverings of the clouds at sunset painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had natural silverings that added a touch of elegance to her appearance.
meanings.sent5: The silverings of the lake under the moonlight created a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The result of applying a silver coating.
meanings.sent1: The silverings on the statue made it look majestic and regal.
meanings.sent2: The silverings of the car made it stand out among the other vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The silverings of the building's facade gave it a modern and sleek appearance.
